alert.note: Alert for Hale; Hockley; Lamb; Lubbock; Lynn; Terry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 8:01PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lubbock, northern Lynn, northeastern Terry, eastern Hockley, western Hale and southeastern Lamb Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 800 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Anton to 5 miles northeast of Locketville to 8 miles north of New Moore. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Slaton, Abernathy, Hale Center, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Anton, Ransom Canyon, Cotton Center, Spade, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Slide, Woodrow, Reese Center, Lubbock International Airport, Texas Tech University, Downtown Lubbock, New Deal, Meadow and Wilson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for northwestern Texas.

area.areaDesc: Hale; Hockley; Lamb; Lubbock; Lynn; Terry
